Content_wSideColumn.BodyCopy:
Apply NOW for student teaching.  Deadlines are listed below, but it is NEVER too early to apply.


Students must apply to student teach up to 18 months before the semester they intend to be placed.  To apply and be eligible to be placed in a school for student teaching, the application includes:

Instructions for Application Checklist

Click here for detailed Application Checklist

Below is a brief overview of the application checklist:

1.     Student Teaching Online Application

The online application is a small part of the application process as a whole. It provides the opportunity for a student to declare their student teaching semester.

Click Here:  Application 

2.     VCC - Verification of Completed Coursework

The VCC is a document that gives the status on your completion of your required courses. It will have to be signed by your advisor(s) and faculty mentor(s) from your major (and minor, if Secondary Education).

·         Bring a copy of your Grad plan to the Education Advising Office (HIN 309) to begin the VCC and verify all required coursework.

3.     Photo

The photo will be attached to your personal bio, which will be given to potential principals for student teaching.

 ·         The campus photography studio (MCK Library 356) will take your photo. This service is free to you unless you choose to purchase more prints. You may go at any time; you do not need an appointment.

4.     Personal Bio

The personal bio is a brief, one-page essay which may include family background, interests, skills that will be utilized in teaching, education, reasons for choosing teaching as a profession, but should emphasize your philosophy of teaching.  

·         For more details about the bio, please view the application checklist pdf.

·         Copy and paste your completed bio into the template provided (click HERE for template). You will be filling in the grey spaces; the text will be grey behind it.

·         Save the template with your inserted text on your computer and then attach the finished template to an email to fieldservices@byui.edu.

5. Background Clearance for the State of Idaho (Fingerprinting)

·         Fingerprinting for the State of Idaho must be done by the application deadline for the semester in which you wish to student teach. This service is provided in the Field Services Office (HIN 325). You do NOT need to make an appointment to be fingerprinted.

·         ALL BYU-I Education majors must be fingerprinted for Idaho regardless of their intended destination for student teaching or career teaching.

·         You will be asked to complete a second set of fingerprints if you are student teaching in any state other than Idaho. This will occur after you have applied and have been assigned to another state.

·         Government-issued ID must be presented before you can be printed. Please bring one of the following: a driver's license, a state issued photo ID, passport, a military card with photo included, etc. . .

 

STUDENT TEACHING PLACEMENTS WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED UNTIL ALL APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS HAVE BEEN MET.

 

For information on the Partner School Interviews, click HERE.

Other Student Teaching Preparation

·         Complete all course work, exams (e.g., three State Literacy Exams (for ELED and ECSE), Praxis (all majors), etc.), and other requirements for graduation.

For more information about the Praxis:

                                      ~  Click HERE for the ETS website

                                      ~  Visit your program faculty lead

·         For detailed information about student teaching, please view the Field Services Preparation Packet

·         Students who have special needs must submit a Request for an Exception to Policy for some of the following reasons:

  • Student teach in southeast Idaho (locally).
  • To take course work during or after student teaching.
  • To student teach without having all Praxis exams passed.
  • To student teach without passing other exams (e.g. Literacy Exams).

Save your Request for an Exception to Policy to your computer, then attach it to an email to the Field Services Office at fieldservices@byui.edu or bring a copy to HIN 325.
